titleStmt.title: D. S. Lane et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5532

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette Govenor of Kentucky-

The undersigned Citizens of Trimble County would respectfully represent to Your Excellency- That at the Oct term 1863 of the Trimble Circuit Court one Mathew McAllister was by a jury of said County, found guilty of an assault & Battery on one, Horton- and his fines asscessed at Two Hundred & fifty dollars- There were no circumstances of peculiar aggravation connected with the case and the verdict is really oppressive- Said McAllister is in very moderate circumstances- and it will be exceedingly oppressive for him to have to pay off said fine-
We think this case presents one for the interposition if executive clemency & he would respectfully ask that said fine so far as can be done May be remitted-

Names
D. S. Lane County Judge
F. A. Adams
C W Garrott Representative
D R Lane
T Mcintosh
J H Lane Justice Peace
J L Lane M D

R S Anderson

By the request of Mr McAllister I send you this the original pettiion drawn by Mr DeHaven - and subscribed to by men who heard the trial &c
